content.description:
Climb either crack, and choose your line up to the top.  You'll need to climb through or around a few small trees on the way.   

  The bottom third of the route is somewhat steep, and the climbing is high-quality.
content.protection: Good gear.  There are several options for a gear anchor above the route.  Walk off to climbers' left.
content.location: Start at two parallel cracks that are ~2 feet apart, in the middle of the Genuflect wall and 20 feet right of the left-leaning ramp that is Genuflect.

content.description: Gear is at the first horizontal a few moves up, making the route PG. You may want a spotter. Stay left of the short, right-facing corners and continue up past the ledge. Continue straight up and stay left of Genuflect's fingercracks.
content.protection: singles of .2 - #1 is all you'll need. Carry a static rope for a tree sling and prepare to set a directional (.2 worked in a little crack on the headwall near the top) if you're planning to TR this one.
content.location: Start 10 feet left of Genuflect at the smallest of a clump of black birch trees.

content.description: Start at a left-leaning ramp, and follow an obvious seam.  Wander up face to the top.  There is a small ledge about half-way up, making this a good route on which to practice "multipitch".
content.protection:
PG.

 If you're setting up a TR anchor, be wary of the boulder up top! Do not build an anchor under it. It looks massive but when pulling the gear to test it, cam lobes opened up and moved the boulder upward. DO NOT USE
content.location: Just across the cul-de-sac from T.P. and Hanky on the Enterprise Wall, at a left-leaning ramp and crack.

content.description: Generally well-shaded, but often damp at the bottom.
